intro: Chailletia sordida, commonly known as the dirty chailletia, is a rare and obscure plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, pale green leaves and clusters of tiny, white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is typically found in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its medicinal properties have been studied for their potential anti-inflammatory effects. Due to habitat loss, Chailletia sordida is considered endangered in its native range.
